description.description_en: Summer, aquatic form: Plants growing in deep water have their leaflets floating on water, the succulent stipes up to 30 cm long; those in shallow water have erect stipes 8-10 cm long; leaflets 20 mm long, entire or crenate; areolae linear, narrow; rhizome internodes 6-9 cm long.Winter, terreestrial form: Plants growing on drained fields much small, the internodes short, about 1-4 mm long, the stipes 2-8 cm long; leaflets 5-10 mm long; sporocarps 1-2, borne at or near base of stipe, on separate stalks, oval, hairy, the upper tooth acute, the lower tooth blunt.
